attributes.action: Stop the 33% downgrade of 2020 A level and GCSE results!
attributes.additional_details: No school sets a child up for something they cannot achieve. Uni places hang in the balance too. You’ve already u-turned on the date results will be available. Kids’ mental health is suffering. A* students with top uni offers face not getting their places. Students with conditional offers have their futures at risk. This is wrong. Bright, deserving, hard-working kids having their futures ripped away that we gave everything for. Please help pass this petition, before more kids’ lives are ruined.
attributes.background:
A-level and GCSE results will be handed out in August this year on the date expected, with results based on work so far: mocks, teacher assessments, and more. Each school has someone to sign them off, but you’ve decided to reduce grades by up to 33%.
We call on you to intervene now and stop this.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that GCSE and A-level students will receive their centre assessment grades: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/gcse-and-a-level-students-to-receive-centre-assessment-grades

Prior to this announcement being made, we had published the following petitions, calling for similar actions to your request: 

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773
